0.Instruction: Extend your right elbow out and grasp the of the scoop handle.

1.Instruction: Flex your right elbow towards your body.

2.Instruction: Extend your right elbow to place scoop over the container.

3.Instruction: You may have to rotate your body towards the container.

4.Instruction: Or you may have to do shoulder adduction to get closer to the container.

6.Instruction: Extend your right elbow to grab the fork handle.

7.Instruction: To place the fork into the container, you can rotate your trunk towards the container.

8.Instruction: Or adduct your shoulder in order for the fork to go over the container.

9.Instruction: Release the fork with your fingers.

10.Instruction: With your right hand, extend your elbow, to grasp the handle tongs.

11.Instruction: If the tongs are to heavy to bring over, use your left arm to move the container towards the middle, closer your body.

12.Instruction: You can also, use your left arm to help support your right wrist if the tongs are too heavy.

13.Instruction: Release your grasp on the tong handle.

14.Instruction: Use your left arm to gently put your right arm down.
